body:
**Describe the bug**
While preparing 0.29.24 for Debian, the documentation cannot be built from sources, due to:

```
writing output... [  7%] src/changes                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Exception occurred:
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/highlighting.py", line 127, in get_lexer
    lexer = lexer_classes[lang](**opts)
TypeError: 'CythonLexer' object is not callable
The full traceback has been saved in /tmp/sphinx-err-8dq5paau.log, if you want to report the issue to the developers.
```

and the full traceback is:

```
# cat /tmp/sphinx-err-8dq5paau.log
# Sphinx version: 4.2.0
# Python version: 3.9.7 (CPython)
# Docutils version: 0.17.1 release
# Jinja2 version: 3.0.1
# Last messages:
#   pickling environment...
#   done
#   checking consistency...
#   done
#   preparing documents...
#   done
#   writing output... [  1%] CONTRIBUTING
#   writing output... [  3%] examples/README
#   writing output... [  5%] index
#   writing output... [  7%] src/changes
# Loaded extensions:
#   sphinx.ext.mathjax (4.2.0) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/ext/mathjax.py
#   alabaster (0.7.12) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/alabaster/__init__.py
#   ipython_console_highlighting (unknown version) from /build/cython-0.29.24/docs/sphinxext/ipython_console_highlighting.py
#   cython_highlighting (unknown version) from /build/cython-0.29.24/docs/sphinxext/cython_highlighting.py
#   sphinx.ext.imgmath (4.2.0) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/ext/imgmath.py
#   sphinx.ext.todo (4.2.0) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/ext/todo.py
#   sphinx.ext.intersphinx (4.2.0) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/ext/intersphinx.py
#   sphinx.ext.autodoc.preserve_defaults (1.0) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/ext/autodoc/preserve_defaults.py
#   sphinx.ext.autodoc.type_comment (4.2.0) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/ext/autodoc/type_comment.py
#   sphinx.ext.autodoc (4.2.0) from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/ext/autodoc/__init__.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/cmd/build.py", line 280, in build_main
    app.build(args.force_all, filenames)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/application.py", line 337, in build
    self.builder.build_update()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/builders/__init__.py", line 293, in build_update
    self.build(to_build,
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/builders/__init__.py", line 357, in build
    self.write(docnames, list(updated_docnames), method)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/builders/__init__.py", line 531, in write
    self._write_serial(sorted(docnames))
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/builders/__init__.py", line 541, in _write_serial
    self.write_doc(docname, doctree)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/builders/html/__init__.py", line 626, in write_doc
    self.docwriter.write(doctree, destination)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/docutils/writers/__init__.py", line 78, in write
    self.translate()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/writers/html.py", line 70, in translate
    self.document.walkabout(visitor)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/docutils/nodes.py", line 227, in walkabout
    if child.walkabout(visitor):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/docutils/nodes.py", line 227, in walkabout
    if child.walkabout(visitor):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/docutils/nodes.py", line 227, in walkabout
    if child.walkabout(visitor):
  [Previous line repeated 3 more times]
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/docutils/nodes.py", line 219, in walkabout
    visitor.dispatch_visit(self)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/util/docutils.py", line 477, in dispatch_visit
    method(node)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/writers/html5.py", line 417, in visit_literal_block
    highlighted = self.highlighter.highlight_block(
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/highlighting.py", line 149, in highlight_block
    lexer = self.get_lexer(source, lang, opts, force, location)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/sphinx/highlighting.py", line 127, in get_lexer
    lexer = lexer_classes[lang](**opts)
TypeError: 'CythonLexer' object is not callable
```

**To Reproduce**

build the doc in a clean chroot

**Expected behavior**
the doc build process completes successfully

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Debian unstable
 - Python version 3.9.7
 - Cython version 029.24

comment_data.body: It looks to me like CythonLexer comes from pygments (https://github.com/pygments/pygments/blob/a98980bd5dda20bf83cd1cc39c1178cb4b490552/pygments/lexers/python.py#L801) so it's possible the bug is there  (or with Sphinx) rather than in Cython

this is coming from https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/0.29.24/docs/sphinxext/cython_highlighting.py (also the other extension , https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/0.29.24/docs/sphinxext/ipython_console_highlighting.py, needs looking into)

Yeah, did manage to reproduce this (and didn't realise Cython bundled it's own Lexer).

From the [Sphinx changelog](https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/changes.html):

> Sphinx.add_lexer() now takes a Lexer class instead of instance. An instance of lexers are still supported until Sphinx-3.x.

I suspect it's just that, and it's a easy change to the last line of the both the files you linked
It's fixed in master 23c3e1e71c42ac4a3d791267a1f8f7ac3df1c3cc. I'm not sure if we should cherry-pick that or update the calls to `add_lexer`. Probably cherry-pick it.
I can confirm this worked and i was able to complete cython upgrade to 0.29.24 in Debian -- thanks for your help!

title: [BUG] 0.29.24: TypeError: 'CythonLexer' object is not callable when building doc
